summary: This code is a Bash script that prints "hello" to the terminal and saves the output to a log file named stdout.log without any redirection for error messages or standard input.

details.comment: This code is a Bash script that prints "hello" to the terminal and saves the output to a log file named stdout.log without any redirection for error messages or standard input.
details.content:
#!/bin/bash
# you are not echoing them.
echo hello > hello
cat hello >(tee -a stdout.log)
#cat hello 1>(tee -a stdout.log) 2>(tee -a stderr.log)
